content: placket tee for ag mini dolls by dawn smith fits 6 -6 5 dolls like american girl mini dolls and lori dolls you will need set of five size 2 us 2 75 mm double-pointed needles 1 size 3 us 3 25 mm single or double-pointed knitting needle used to cast off hem 12 to 15 yards fingering-weight yarn 4 tiny stitch markers optional 1 small snap and thread to sew it on optional abbreviations k - knit p - purl kfb - knit into front and back of next stitch to increase by 1 pm - place marker bobble - bind off m-kfb - mirrored kfb increase see note p2tog - purl two stitches together to decrease by 1 notes the stitch markers are helpful in tracking repeated sections and keeping up with stitch counts slip the markers when you come to them the long-tail cast-on is recommended for a slightly stretchy neckline edge here is a tutorial for the mirrored kfb in case it is new to you https //www youtube com/shorts/z9b6nz9pxje if preferred you can substitute regular kfb for the m-kfb but purl bumps will appear on one side of the front and not the other ---- pattern starts here ---- the first part is knitted flat on two needles until after it is joined in the round in row 11 using size 2 needles and fingering yarn cast on 18 stitches using the long-tail cast-on method row 1 k1 kfb k1 pm kfb k1 kfb k1 pm 3 times kfb k2 26 stitches row 2 k2 purl to last two stitches k2 row 3 k2 kfb k1 kfb k3 kfb k1 3 times kfb k3 34 stitches row 4 k2 purl to last two stitches k2 row 5 k3 kfb k1 kfb k5 kfb k1 3 times kfb k4 42 stitches row 6 k2 purl to last two stitches k2 row 7 k4 kfb k1 kfb k7 kfb k1 3 times kfb k5 50 stitches row 8 k2 purl to last two stitches k2 you will remove the markers in row 9 row 9 k7 kfb bobble 13 first stitch bound off is the last stitch of the kfb kfb k9 kfb bobble 13 first stitch bound off is the last stitch of the kfb kfb k4 28 stitches row 10 k2 p4 p2tog p11 p2tog p5 k2 26 stitches be sure to snug the p2togs tightly you are closing the gap under the arms you will now knit onto 4 needles and join in the round row 11 dividing onto 4 dpns as follows first needle - k2 2nd needle - k8 3rd needle - k8 4th needle - k6 place the first needle behind the last two stitches on the left needle this joins in the round k the 2 sets of stitches together as the last 2 stitches you will wind up with 24 stitches on three needles 8 8 8 which are joined in the round round 1 k5 m-kfb k11 kfb
